titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Office of Training records, 1865-2002 RG0065

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: George Washington Univeristy. Office of Training

did.abstract: Collection includes slides, correspondence, manuals, and course registration information.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Office of Training records , University Archives, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Series 1 is closed to research for 25 years from the date of record creation.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials acquired through transfers from Office of Training.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Employee Training and Development offers a wide variety of courses and seminars that help employees of the University enhance their job skills. Workshops include topics such as customer service, effective writing, time management, general office skills, employee orientation, workshops for new managers.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in the collection include slides, correspondence, manuals, and course registration. The material dates from 1865-2002. Note: Not all series are processed. Ask staff for assistance.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: Medical Center, two series titled Images of campus life, Courses, and Professional development records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains user manuals. These manuals are from the Medical Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains slides. These 217 slides include images of The George Washington University Hospital, staff, and faculty.

did.unittitle: Hospital building, hospital kitchen, administrative staff

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Names of administrative staff include: Elmer Kayser, W.M. P. Smith, Dean Linton, Mr. Houser, Provost Colclough, Pres. Carroll, Dr. Latimer, Dr. Woodruff Kramer, Dr. Kirkbride, Mr. Herzog, Mrs. Borden

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence and course registration. The material covers the years 1979-86.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains approximately 1,000 slides. Subjects include campus buildings, faculty, students, and staff. These slides were used for new employee orientations, and range in date from 1865-1995.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Faculty and Staff, including James Horton, Marcus Cunliffe, Administrative personnel. Convocation and registration scenes.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Campus scenes: computer labs, students in class. Old university seals, buildings, including old Preparatory School, Tin Tabernacle (ca. 1924), University Yard, Washington Monument under construction.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Campus Buildings including Gelman library, law school, medical buildings, construction scenes, aerial photos of campus, Fords Theater (ca. 1865).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Hospital Scenes, gross anatomy class (ca. 1896), operating rooms (ca. 1950s), rehab, rooms, medical students and staff. Drawings of campus buildings.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Drawings of buildings, College Hill (ca. 1821), Capital building. Civil war photos, Carver Barracks, general hospital, Columbian College building (ca. 1865). Prominent people, William Staughton, Thomas Sewall, Walter Reed, Riley, Glasscock, President Coolidge, President Kennedy, President Truman.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Approximately 625 slides used to train new employees, housed in a three-ring binder. Subjects include images used for brochures, Student Accounts Office, Admissions Office, GW seal, aerial views from roof tops, students moving in to dorms, cupola of Corcoran Hall, metro station, university yard, Gelman Library, research, mailroom, computer room, Engineering Dept., Academic Center, Munson Hall, Rice Hall office 5th floor, professors office, banners, Lisner Auditorium, J Street in Marvin Center, clock by Gelman Library, bookstore, classroom scenes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuals, pamphlets, schedules, catalogs, correspondence, and flyers. They range in date from 1980 to 2002. They concern strategies for supervision, discipline in the work environment, workshops, development opportunities, seminars, employee performance appraisal, staff development, quality management, and interviewing.
